marketNews.title: Sell in May and Go Away?
marketNews.content: "Sell in May if you must, but invest with brains , not fear." - Ruthmarthaamelias

tickerNews.title: Bank BBNI 1Q25: Net Profit +1% YoY, In Line with Expectations
tickerNews.content: Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) recorded a net profit of 5.4 trillion rupiah in 1Q25 (+1% YoY, +4.4% QoQ), relatively in line with expectations (equivalent to 23% of consensus 2025F estimates). Maintained asset quality is a positive aspect. On the other hand, NIM experienced pressure in line with BBNI management's priority on the company's liquidity.

tickerNews.title: NIM Pressured
tickerNews.content: Net Interest Income (NII) grew +4.7% YoY to the level of 9.8 trillion rupiah. However, bank-only Loan Yield was pressured to 7.4% (vs. 1Q24: 7.5%, 4Q24: 7.9%) due to increasing competition, so interest income only grew +5.3% YoY amid credit growth of +10% YoY. Meanwhile, interest expense increased +6.1% YoY in line with the company's priority to secure funding amidst tight liquidity conditions, causing the bank-only Cost of Fund (CoF) to rise to 2.8% (vs. 1Q24: 2.8%, 4Q24: 2.7%). The dynamics of these two metrics caused NIM to reach only 3.9% in 1Q25 (vs. 1Q24: 4%, 4Q24: 4.5%), lower than management's 2025 guidance in the range of 4-4.2%.

tickerNews.title: Liquidity Priority
tickerNews.content: The liquidity priority is reflected in the Loan-to-Deposit Ratio (LDR) falling to 93% from the December 2024 level of 96%, in line with management's 2025 target aiming for an LDR below 95%. According to management, the outlook for improvement in banking liquidity conditions remains uncertain as long as the rupiah exchange rate is under pressure, although there is a significant maturity of SRBI in the near future.

tickerNews.title: PPOP Growth Affected by Non-Interest Income
tickerNews.content: Meanwhile, Pre-provision Operating Profit (PPOP) grew only +1.6% YoY due to weak Non-Interest Income (-0.5% YoY) as fee income grew slightly (+2.6% YoY) and a decrease in recovery income (-7.5% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Asset Quality Relatively Maintained
tickerNews.content: Credit cost (CoC) stood at 0.9% in 1Q25 (vs. 1Q24: 1%, 4Q24: 1.5%). Although slightly below management's 2025 guidance of ~1%, this was due to reversals from several corporate clients. Therefore, management maintained the CoC guidance for 2025 at the level of ~1%. Meanwhile, NPL and LAR were relatively stable compared to the end of 2024, at levels of 2% (vs. 1Q24: 2%, 4Q24: 2%) and 10.9% (vs. 1Q24: 13.3%, 4Q24: 10.3%) respectively.

tickerNews.title: Trade War Risk Exposure
tickerNews.content: Regarding trade war risk, BBNI management revealed that direct exposure - clients who export to the US - is around 3% of total credit. With tighter loan underwriting standards compared to a few years ago and adequate provision (coverage), management is optimistic that even if there are changes to the 2025 CoC guidance, the change will not be significant.

tickerNews.title: Key Takeaway for BBNI
tickerNews.content: Overall, we tend to be neutral regarding BBNI's performance realization in 1Q25. BBNI management itself is maintaining the 2025 guidance for now, but opens the opportunity to revise the 2025 guidance after the release of 2Q25 performance.

tickerNews.title: DMAS: Dividend Rp29/Share, Indicative Yield 16.3%
tickerNews.content: 1. DMAS: Shareholders of Puradelta Lestari on Monday (28/4) approved the plan to distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to ~1.4 trillion rupiah or 29 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a 105% dividend payout ratio and indicates a dividend yield of 16.3% as of Monday (28/4). The cum date and payment date have not been announced. In the 2023 fiscal year, DMAS did not distribute a final dividend and only distributed an interim dividend of 12 rupiah per share in December 2023.

tickerNews.title: UNTR to Expand Non-Coal Mineral Portfolio
tickerNews.content: 2. UNTR: United Tractors Director, Iwan Hadiantoro, said that his party will expand its business portfolio in non-coal mineral sectors, such as nickel, gold, copper, and silver. Iwan also explained that they are considering expansion into the bauxite commodity, and are currently conducting feasibility studies for lithium development. UNTR will budget around 500 million to 1 billion US dollars per year to expand its non-coal mineral portfolio.

tickerNews.title: SRTG Increases Stake in AADI
tickerNews.content: 3. AADI: Saratoga Investama Sedaya (SRTG), the shareholder of Adaro Andalan Indonesia, purchased ~71.6 million AADI shares at an average price of 6,005 rupiah per share on April 21, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~430 billion rupiah. After this transaction, SRTG's ownership in AADI increased from 3.46% to 4.38%.

tickerNews.title: SCMA Approves Final Dividend for 2024
tickerNews.content: 4. SCMA: Surya Citra Media shareholders on Monday (28/4) approved the plan to distribute a final dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of 18 rupiah per share, indicating a final dividend yield of 8.8% as of Monday (28/4). The cum date and payment date have not been announced. Previously, SCMA distributed an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 5 rupiah per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: DRMA 1Q25 Net Profit +7% YoY, Supported by Other Income
tickerNews.content: 5. DRMA: Dharma Polimetal recorded a net profit of 143 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (+7% YoY, -15% QoQ), in line with expectations as it equals 23% of consensus 2025F estimates (vs. 1Q24 realization: 23% of 2024 net profit). Sales were recorded at 1.5 trillion rupiah in 1Q25 (+9% YoY, -2% QoQ), in line with expectations (25% of consensus 2025F estimates), with solid growth in the motorcycle segment (+16% YoY) compensating for the decrease in the car segment revenue (-10% YoY). Net profit growth was mainly driven by other income which nearly doubled year-on-year to 17 billion rupiah (vs. 1Q24: 9 billion rupiah, 4Q24: 20 billion rupiah), while operating profit was flat year-on-year at 171 billion rupiah (+0% YoY, -15% QoQ) due to a decline in gross profit margin to 11.7% (vs. 1Q24: 12.8%, 4Q24: 13.6%) and an increase in opex (+6% YoY, +11% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: PRDA Approves 2024 Dividend
tickerNews.content: 6. PRDA: Prodia Widyahusada shareholders on Monday (28/4) approved the plan to distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to ~162.1 billion rupiah or 172.92 rupiah per share, equivalent to ~60% dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 6.2% as of Monday (28/4). The cum date and payment date have not been announced.

tickerNews.title: PGEO 1Q25 Net Profit Below Expectations
tickerNews.content: 7. PGEO: Pertamina Geothermal Energy recorded a net profit of 31 million US dollars in 1Q25 (-34% YoY, +18% QoQ), below expectations (20% of consensus 2025F estimates). The annual decline in net profit was mainly driven by an increase in the cost of revenue to 43 million US dollars (+7% YoY, +32% QoQ) and an exchange rate loss of 9 million US dollars (vs. 1Q24: profit of 5 million US dollars, 4Q24: profit of 3 million US dollars). However, PGEO still recorded relatively stable EBITDA of 84 million US dollars in 1Q25 (-2% YoY, +21% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: BNGA Plans Sharia Unit Spin-off
tickerNews.content: 8. BNGA: CIMB Niaga plans to conduct a spin-off of its sharia business unit by establishing a sharia commercial bank named PT Bank CIMB Niaga Syariah. This corporate action is carried out to comply with POJK No. 12/2023. This plan will be discussed at the GMS on June 26, 2025.

tickerNews.title: PANI and CBDK 1Q25 Marketing Sales Decline
tickerNews.content: 9. PANI: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua recorded marketing sales of 466 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (-69% YoY, -65% QoQ), equivalent to 9% of the 2025 target. Meanwhile, Bangun Kosambi Sukses (CBDK) recorded marketing sales of 239 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (-74% YoY, -65% QoQ), equivalent to 12% of the 2025 target. Previously, during the analyst meeting in April 2025, management projected soft marketing sales in 1Q25. Management explained that the decline in PANI's marketing sales was caused by decreased consumer confidence. Meanwhile, the decline in CBDK's marketing sales was due to the allocation of part of the land for investment property projects, including the construction of the Nusantara International Convention and Exhibition (NICE) which is planned to start partial operations in October 2025. Management remains optimistic about the marketing sales prospects, supported by the partial operation of the Kataraja toll road.

tickerNews.title: ARNA Plans Share Buyback Up to IDR 100 Billion
tickerNews.content: 10. ARNA: Arwana Citramulia plans to conduct a share buyback with an allocation of funds up to 100 billion rupiah from April 29 to July 29, 2025, although the company did not specify the maximum number of shares to be purchased. This plan does not require GMS approval, in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability.

tickerNews.title: TPMA Plans Share Buyback Up to IDR 80 Billion
tickerNews.content: 11. TPMA: Trans Power Marine plans to buy back up to 100 million (2.85%) shares with a fund allocation of up to 80 billion rupiah from April 29 to July 28, 2025. This plan does not require GMS approval, in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability.

tickerNews.title: US President Donald Trump Claims US-China Trade Talks
tickerNews.content: 1. US President, Donald Trump, told Time magazine on Friday (25/4) that the US government is talking with China to reach a tariff agreement. Trump also claimed that Chinese President, Xi Jinping, had contacted him. Trump's statement was contrary to the statement from the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs on Friday (25/4), which urged the US government to stop "misleading the public." Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, Guo Jiakun, said that the US and China are not currently involved in negotiations regarding tariff issues.

tickerNews.title: Housing Minister Raises MBR Income Ceiling for Low-Income Housing
tickerNews.content: 2. Minister of Housing and Settlements, Maruarar Sirait, released new regulations that raise the maximum income limit for low-income communities (MBR), depending on the respective zoning. For the Jabodetabek area, the maximum MBR income becomes 12 million rupiah per month for single workers and 14 million rupiah per month for married workers. Previously, the maximum MBR income criteria for single workers was 7 million rupiah per month, while for married workers it was 8 million rupiah per month.

tickerNews.title: WINS 1Q25 Net Profit Declines Due to Lower Revenue and Higher Operating Expenses
tickerNews.content: 3. WINS: Wintermar Offshore Marine (WINS) recorded a net profit of 1.6 million US dollars (-41% QoQ, -26% YoY) in 1Q25, caused by a revenue decline of -20% QoQ and an increase in operating expenses of +23% QoQ. The revenue decline occurred in all segments, especially the owned vessel segment (-13% QoQ) which contributed ~89% of total revenue in 1Q25. The decline in the owned vessel segment occurred as the spot contracts for the mid-tier fleet ended and demand slowed due to project postponements. Ship utilization in 1Q25 dropped to 57% (vs. 4Q24: 63%).

tickerNews.title: FILM Plans Rights Issue to Pay Off Debt to BMRI
tickerNews.content: 4. FILM: MD Entertainment (FILM) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to ~990 million new shares with an dilution effect of up to 9.09%. The exercise price has not been announced, while the proceeds are intended to repay debt to Bank Mandiri (BMRI) and working capital. The controller of FILM, PT MD Corp Enterprises and Manoj Dhamoo Punjabi, will exercise all their rights. The cum rights in the regular market and negotiation phases are on July 4, 2025, with the rights implementation period on July 10-18, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Northstar Sells DOID Shares
tickerNews.content: 5. The controlling shareholder of BUMA Internasional Grup (DOID), Northstar Tambang Persada Ltd., sold 340 million DOID shares at a price of 406 rupiah per share on April 23, 2025. The total transaction value reached 138 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Northstar Tambang Persada Ltd.'s ownership in DOID decreased from 42.661% to 38.217%.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Approves 2024 Dividend Distribution
tickerNews.content: 6. AKRA shareholders approved the distribution of dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to ~2 trillion rupiah or equivalent to an 88% dividend payout ratio, indicating a final dividend of 50 rupiah per share with a final dividend yield of 4.2% as of Monday (28/4). Cum date in the regular market and negotiation phases is on May 7, 2025, while payment is on May 22, 2025. Previously, AKRA distributed an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 987 billion rupiah or 50 rupiah per share in August 2024.

tickerNews.title: AALI Approves 2024 Dividend and Appoints New President Director
tickerNews.content: 7. AALI: Astra Agro Lestari shareholders on Monday (28/4) approved the distribution of dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 515.8 billion rupiah or equivalent to ~45% dividend payout ratio, indicating a final dividend of 184 rupiah per share with a final dividend yield of 3.1% as of Monday (28/4). The cum date has not been announced, while payment is on May 28, 2025. Previously, AALI distributed an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 84 rupiah per share in October 2024. In addition to dividends, AALI shareholders also appointed Djap Tet Fa as the new President Director to replace Santosa.

tickerNews.title: ELPI 2024 Final Dividend Details
tickerNews.content: 8. Pelayaran Nasional Ekalya Purnamasari (ELPI) will distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to ~100 billion rupiah or 13.5 rupiah per share, equivalent to ~40% dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 3.6% as of Monday (28/4). Cum date in the regular market and negotiation phases is on May 5, 2025, while payment is on May 23, 2025.

tickerNews.title: PTRO 1Q25 Net Profit Surges 464% YoY due to Lower Costs
tickerNews.content: 9. PTRO: Petrosea (PTRO) recorded a net profit of 1 million US dollars in 1Q25 (+464% YoY, -87% QoQ). The annual increase in net profit was mainly driven by a decrease in the cost of revenue (-2% YoY, -15% QoQ) and operating expenses (-7% YoY, -19% QoQ). In addition, exchange rate gains reached 7 million US dollars (vs. 1Q24: profit of 4 million US dollars, 4Q24: profit of 8 million US dollars).

tickerNews.title: SILO Acquires Land for Makassar Hospital Expansion
tickerNews.content: 10. SILO: Siloam International Hospitals (SILO) acquired land measuring 2,036 square meters in Mariso Sub-district, Makassar from an affiliated party. The total transaction value reached 42.2 billion rupiah. This acquisition is in line with the expansion plan for Siloam Makassar Hospital.
